Ready for Hire!

I love to learn how things work, and how to solve problems creatively. I once repaired the blown fuse from my pedicab's running lights with a piece of broken guitar string so i could keep working. I've brought this attitude into my web design and I'm looking for a company to continue this journey of expression and resourcefulness.

Web Design caught my eye at an early age. I tinkered on Angelfire in 2001, and my Myspace page was a blinking, sparkly, emo wonder. In July of 2015 I decided I could do better than my Myspace profile, so I enrolled in the Web Design course offered at The Iron Yard. In 3 months I learned HTML, CSS, SASS, Bourbon, Typekit, Google Fonts, Typography, Jekyll, UI Design, Photoshop, Illustrator, some Art History, and I even managed to start working with JQuery and Twillio.

I've included my portfolio/blog. Inside I left my recent work for a local band and my final project. The latter of which is currently being used as a ride hailing/tour booking webapp for a pedicab company downtown (do what you know, right?). I would love the opportunity to get to know your company more in person, and I appreciate your time and consideration. Thank you and I look forward to hearing from you.

Check out my recent work!
